title: Building my own Hextech Chest - Needing help from Rioter's
body:
Hello dear Board,

as I recently thought about a possible present for my girlfriend's birthday, I stumbled over the idea of building my own little Hextech Chest (with glass, wood and LED's) and put a little LoL figure inside. Problem is, that there isn't really a nice picture of the Hextech, regarding the backside and the bottom of the chest. 
So I would be really happy if any Rioter from the desing team or anybody else could help me fulfill my idea.

Best regards,
SirPenco.

{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

replies.body:
Hello!

So I asked around, and found a Rioter who is going to try to get you the information you need for the base and back of the Hextech crate, by next week.  Hopefully that's not too late for you in time for your gf's birthday.

But!  There's a cost.  We **demand* ** to see photographs of the finished product in exchange ;)  

Were you thinking of making the Premium chest box, or the standard one?  Let me know, and I can tell the Rioter (they are a little too shy to come to the Boards) who's working on the art for it.

{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-rainbows}} 

######Ok, we don't 'demand' but we'd both really really love to see photos.

Hey mate!

Thank you for your high efforts to help me, I really appreciate that and will definetly post some picture of the finished crate! :D
And don't worry about the time, there's still plenty of time to go until she has birthday, so don't pressure yourselves too much.

Oh, and before I forget it, I want to build the normal Hextech crate, because I already have the blue LED's.

Thank you very much again for the quick help!
{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

Does this give you enough information to be getting on with your own hextech 'crafting'?  (Sorry, I couldn't resist.)

Thank you very much!

I'll definetly post the result here as soon as I finished the crate, even tho it will take some weeks. And if you like too, I can even mail you or the kind designer the pictures too, so you won't overlook it when it's finally done.

And could you pass on my thanks to the designer? He helpem me A LOT.

Rito show this person some love and help them with their project because it sounds cool.

I really really hope a rioter can help him some way.
I would loved to see pictures of this as well.
